alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 3:26AM EST until December 20 at 9:43AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Piscataquis River at Medford. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Medford Road between Alder Brook to Robin Hollow Drive. Minor flooding along the lowland areas from Trestle Road Bridge downstream to Maxfield townline. Minor flooding along River Road and North Howland Road to I-95 Bridge in Maxfield to Howland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Flooding is ongoing - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Wednesday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 6.0 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 930 AM EST.
